image.altText: An embossed metal sign on a building that reads "Department of Education".

props.synopsis: A "psychopathic" paedophile, who later boasted of sexually abusing 2,000 boys, was employed as a Victorian Education Department school teacher despite declaring in a 1970s job application form that he was a convicted child abuser.

title.children: 'Psychopathic' paedophile was given teaching job despite declaring abuse conviction on application

image.altText: Suburban street scene from above

props.synopsis: It's a Victorian tax hitting up investors sitting on empty residential properties — but analysis suggests it could be missing roughly 90 per cent of so-called "ghost homes" eligible for the charge, less than a year out from a planned expansion of the levy.

title.children: Why Victoria's vacant homes tax could be missing most of the empty properties owned by investors

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission has revealed Australia's use of cocaine, methylamphetamine and nicotine is on the up, but cannabis remains the illicit drug of choice.

title.children: Cocaine, meth use in Australia reaching record-level highs

image.altText: Silhouette of man in front of green screen displaying a Linux command window.

props.synopsis: Australia's cyber intelligence agency says a Chinese government-backed hacking group known as APT 40 has been targeting government and private sector networks here and around the region. But what exactly is an "APT" and what do they do?

title.children: Australia has accused China of backing a cyber espionage group. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Danielle Wood productivity commission

props.synopsis: Most Australians are economically better off than their parents when at a similar age, but that's increasingly not the case for those in poverty, women, and people born after 1990, according to the Productivity Commission.

title.children: Worrying signs emerge from new economic mobility report

image.altText: A large fire on the roof of a factory, shown from the air.

props.synopsis: A factory fire sparked by a chemical explosion has been brought under control, but authorities say they expect it to burn for days.

title.children: 'Fireball' explosions and flying debris seen at site of Melbourne factory fire

image.altText: Alex de Minaur slides to hit a forehand during a tennis match at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: As Alex de Minaur sat and spoke about the dangers of sliding on grass, he had an inkling his Wimbledon campaign might have been ended by doing just that.

title.children: The 'freak movement' that ended Alex de Minaur's Wimbledon and why grass courts are uniquely risky

image.altText: A composite photo of Bukayo Saka and Virgil van Dijk celebrating

props.synopsis: England has been underwhelming during this European Championships, but they've still made it to a semifinal against the Netherlands, with Spain waiting in the final. Follow live.

title.children: England fans attacked ahead of Netherlands Euros semifinal clash

image.altText: The Twelve Apostles landform

props.synopsis: The Victorian government denies it plans to introduce paid parking along the Great Ocean Road, including the Twelve Apostles, days after the proposal was announced.

title.children: State government denies plan to slug visitors to Victoria's Great Ocean Road with parking fees

image.altText: Alex de Minaur gestures with his hand after winning a match at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Australian hopeful Alex de Minaur has pulled out of Wimbledon with a hip injury, just hours before he was due to play Novak Djokovic in his first quarter-final at the All England Club.

title.children: Alex de Minaur denied Wimbledon showdown with Novak Djokovic by 'freak injury'

image.altText: A woman with red glasses standing in front of a boat and islands.

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old man has been charged with murder after a woman's body was found at a waste management facility in Melbourne's north last week.

title.children: Man charged with murdering woman whose body was found at a waste facility in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A photo showing Jacob, with three legs, walking at night time.

props.synopsis: A record-breaking swim by two lion brothers, one an amputee, across a predator-infested African river is being held up as an example of how animals are making tough decisions to find homes and mates in a human-dominated world.

title.children: Cameras capture lions' 'record-breaking' swim through crocodile-infested waters

image.altText: A stylised image shows an identikit face of an older man over a corkboard background

props.synopsis: Today marks 30 years since the body of a tall, well-dressed man was pulled from the waters off Germany. Investigators hoping tip-offs from Australia and genetic mapping may help crack the case.

title.children: A cold ocean, a mystery man and a DNA surprise — why Australians may hold the key to a 30-year-old cold case

image.altText: In a sequence of images, a young Indigenous teen is held down and struck with a baton by police.

props.synopsis: 7.30 has obtained footage showing police beating an Indigenous youth repeatedly with a baton in a watch house, sparking allegations of excessive use of force.

title.children: 'Abhorrent and distressing': Multiple police beat teenager locked in watch house

image.altText: a group of about 15 police officers standing together in the cbd

props.synopsis: The NT police minister confirmed a decision on whether to extend the Alice Springs curfew will be made on Thursday morning, after the lock-out restrictions expire.

title.children: Violent brawl breaks out in Alice Springs ahead of curfew decision

image.altText: Naarah poses sidewards to camera, smiling, with her hands up together wearing gloves in London

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Actor Naarah answers all the money questions we don't like to talk about as we seek to demystify personal finance and normalise conversations about how we think about money, what we earn and how we spend it.

title.children: 'I've been saving at least $2 a week since I was little': The money habits that allowed Naarah to buy a house in her 20s

image.altText: A man with a beard and black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: Authorities say the man is receiving treatment for injuries after being apprehended in connection with the domestic triple murder in north-western London.

title.children: Man suspected of killing the family of BBC radio commentator has been found, British police say

image.altText: A star which looks like a firework.

props.synopsis: A spectacular nova may be about to light up our night sky in the constellation Corona Borealis. If it does, Australians will only have a short window to catch it.

title.children: If predictions are right, we could see an exploding star on the horizon soon

image.altText: Snakes lie on top of each other in a plastic bag which sits on a metal table

props.synopsis: Chinese officials stopped the man and found the reptiles — including milk snakes and corn snakes — in bags inside his pockets.

title.children: Man caught trying to smuggle more than 100 live snakes inside his trousers

image.altText: A crashed car.

props.synopsis: A teenager accused of driving a stolen car involved in a fatal crash in Melbourne's east has had his bail revoked.

title.children: Teenager allegedly involved in fatal crash in Melbourne's east has bail revoked

image.altText: The pope speaks into a silver-coloured microphone.

props.synopsis: The document will inform bishops at their October summit, where the role of women in the Church is on the agenda.

title.children: A Vatican document says women need 'fuller recognition' in the Catholic Church — but not as deacons

image.altText: Mountain rescue stand on snowy peak with body on stretcher

props.synopsis: A climber discovered the body of a man buried in an avalanche in the Huascaran peak 22 years ago while he was making his own ascent.

title.children: Climber finds body of man buried in Peru avalanche 22 years ago

image.altText: An eight-year-old girl with dark hair and wearing a pink cap sits on the knee of a person whose image is blurred.

props.synopsis: The court heard the eight-year-old was left the care of three members of a religious congregation of which the parents were also members.

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs spent last hours on a mattress on the floor as parents slept, court hears

image.altText: Kitchen bench top

props.synopsis: Tradies will still have to work with engineered stone when renovating or demolishing existing kitchens and bathrooms, risking exposure to fine silica dust.

title.children: Engineered stone is now banned. What will happen with existing benchtops?

image.altText: A woman works at a desk with three screens.

props.synopsis: Australians are now much less likely to leave seek new employment, with job mobility falling for the first time in three years, according to the latest ABS figures.

title.children: Australians are struggling more to find jobs over 'too many applicants'

image.altText: A man in a pink shirts walks in front of blue and white boats tilted in all directions.

props.synopsis: Hurricane Beryl tears across the Atlantic Ocean, leaving at least 11 people dead in the Caribbean and three in the US state of Texas.

title.children: Hurricane Beryl leaves trail of destruction across Caribbean

image.altText: boxes of lemons and apples fill the frame of this photo

props.synopsis: Families and neighbours shopping through informal co-ops are saving hundreds, but the business model could help apply major competitive pressure to the major supermarkets.

title.children: There is a cheaper alternative to supermarkets, but most people don't know it exists

image.altText: A close up of Joe Biden speaking passionately and pointing with his right hand

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has given his highest-profile policy speech since his halting debate performance sparked speculation about his fitness for office. Here are the key moments from his NATO address.

title.children: Ukraine will stop Putin, Biden tells NATO in forceful speech

image.altText: Narendra Modi and Vladimir Putin shake hands while smiling in front of an Indian and Russian flag

props.synopsis: Narendra Modi's pointed remarks came just moments after he was welcomed to the Kremlin by Vladimir Putin.

title.children: Indian PM tells Putin deaths of children 'terrifying' a day after deadly hospital strike in Ukraine

image.altText: Filicide study

props.synopsis: About 20 children are murdered by a parent every year in Australia. It's a crime that evokes equal measures of horror and confusion. At the crux of the issue is male-perpetrated violence.

title.children: The psychology behind filicide — explaining the unexplainable

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses in front of the ocean

props.synopsis: Geraldton man Matthew Watson had a bad feeling when his friend didn't return to the boat during a spearfishing trip near Coral Bay on Monday. Then, he spotted him bleeding in the water.

title.children: 'I've been hit': Man describes pulling mate bitten by shark from waters off remote WA coast

image.altText: A man with his head bandaged and a pained expression sits on a hospital floor next to a young boy

props.synopsis: Palestinian officials say an Israeli air strike in southern Gaza has killed dozens of people while advancing tanks in Gaza City forced residents to flee under fire as Israel stepped up an offensive that Hamas warned could jeopardise ceasefire talks.

title.children: 'Gaza City is being wiped out': Residents flee under fire as Israeli tanks advance in renewed campaign

image.altText: A bespectacled man with a grey goatee wears a blue top as he sits with his arms on a table in front of him.

props.synopsis: Within a year of landing her first full-time teaching job, Oh Jae Geun's daughter took her own life after overzealous parents ruthlessly scrutinised her performance and threatened to make criminal complaints to the police.

title.children: Oh Jae Geun's daughter was a teacher. After her death, he found shocking stories about parents in her phone

image.altText: A split screen image of damage in Israel and a woman in southern Lebanon

props.synopsis: An Israeli town 1 kilometre from the Lebanon border is all but deserted as the threat of a new war looms. Inside Lebanon, residents are also preparing for a full-scale conflict.

title.children: Thousands of strikes across the Lebanon-Israel border put the region on alert for a new war

image.altText: A blue coloured T logo with an orange oval mounted on a fake grass wall

props.synopsis: The telecommunications company faces an ACMA directive to correct an error which led to more than 140,000 customer records being made public, despite those customers paying for their information to remain unlisted.

title.children: ACMA issues directive to Telstra after massive privacy breach of unlisted numbers
